alert.note: Alert for McKinley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 5:24PM MDT until August 16 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western McKinley County in west central New Mexico... * Until 800 PM MDT. * At 524 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts ranging from 0.25 to 0.50 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms producing moderate to heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Western Gallup, Rock Springs, Tse Bonito, Yah-Ta-Hey, Mentmore, Twin Lakes and Gamerco. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 near Mile Marker 12. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
